prompt:
TASK: Set up the OM Comparables Recipe environment for first-time use.

GOAL: Install dependencies and launch the Next.js web server so the user can view comparables data.

STEPS:

1. CHECK IF SERVER IS ALREADY RUNNING
   - Run: lsof -ti :3001
   - If a process ID is returned, the server is already running
   - If already running, skip to Step 4 (success message)
   - If not running, proceed to Step 2

2. INSTALL DEPENDENCIES (if needed)
   - Navigate to: cd /Users/betojuareziii/Applications/Goose\ Recipes/OM_Comparables_Recipe/comparables-app
   - Check if node_modules exists: ls -la node_modules 2>/dev/null
   - If node_modules doesn't exist or is empty:
     * Run: npm install
     * Wait for installation to complete
     * Verify success: check for node_modules folder and package-lock.json
   - If node_modules exists and has content, skip npm install

3. START THE NEXT.JS SERVER
   - Navigate to: cd /Users/betojuareziii/Applications/Goose\ Recipes/OM_Comparables_Recipe/comparables-app
   - Start the server in the background: npm run dev > /tmp/nextjs-comparables.log 2>&1 &
   - Wait 15 seconds for server initialization: sleep 15
   - Verify the server is running:
     * Test: curl -f http://localhost:3001 -o /dev/null -s -w "%{http_code}"
     * Expected: 200 status code
     * If connection refused, wait 5 more seconds and retry (max 3 retries)
   - If server fails to start after retries:
     * Report error: "ERROR: Server failed to start. Check /tmp/nextjs-comparables.log for details"
     * Provide troubleshooting steps
     * STOP here

4. FINAL SUCCESS MESSAGE
   Once the server is confirmed running, display this message:

   âœ… Setup Complete!
   
   ðŸŒ Next.js server is running on: http://localhost:3001
   
   You can now:
   1. Run the comparables extraction recipe:
      goose run search_comps --document_paths "/path/to/document.pdf"
   
   2. View your results in the browser:
      - Comparables Report: http://localhost:3001/comparables
      - Comp Sets Manager: http://localhost:3001/comp-sets
   
   ðŸ“ Notes:
   - The server will continue running in the background
   - Server logs are written to: /tmp/nextjs-comparables.log
   - To stop the server: lsof -ti :3001 | xargs kill
   - To restart the server: Run this recipe again or manually: cd comparables-app && npm run dev
   
   ðŸŽ¯ Next Step: Run the search_comps recipe to extract comparables from your PDF documents!

ERROR HANDLING:
- If port 3001 is in use by another application, provide instructions to kill that process
- If npm install fails, check Node.js version (requires 18+) and npm installation
- If server won't start, direct user to check /tmp/nextjs-comparables.log for errors

retry.on_failure: echo 'Setup failed. Server is not running on port 3001. Check /tmp/nextjs-comparables.log for errors.'
